summary: When using ts-node with swc-loader, the bundler sometimes includes regenerator-runtime in the webpack bundle even though it's not needed for Node 14+ target, causing module resolution failures. The issue was resolved by including swc-loader in the SDK.
userImpact: Users experience webpack build failures when running workers with ts-node using @temporalio/create due to unresolved regenerator-runtime dependency.
rootCause: swc-loader was transforming generators and async functions to include regenerator-runtime even when the build target (Node 14+) supports them natively; issue was in upstream swc project but workaround needed in SDK configuration.
proposedFix: Set swc-loader target to at least ES2017 to prevent unnecessary regenerator-runtime inclusion, as demonstrated in swc playground.
workaround: Add regenerator-runtime as a devDependency to resolve the module not found error.
resolutionDetails: swc-loader was included in version 0.20.2 with proper configuration to prevent regenerator-runtime from being unnecessarily bundled.
